Shortcuts

Hessian Estimators¶

class pytorch_laplace.MSEHessianCalculator(*args, **kwargs)¶

Mean Square Error

compute_loss(x, target, nnj_module)¶

Computes Mean Square Error

Parameters:

  • x (Tensor) – input of the network

  • target (Tensor) – output of the network

  • nnj_module (Sequential) – neural network module

Return type:

Tensor

compute_gradient(x, target, nnj_module)¶

Computes gradient of the network

Parameters:

  • x (Tensor) – input of the network

  • target (Tensor) – output of the network

  • nnj_module (Sequential) – neural network module

Return type:

Tensor

compute_hessian(x, target, nnj_module)¶

Compute generalized-gauss newton (GGN) approximation of the Hessian. Jacobian sandwich of the identity for each element in the batch H = identity matrix (None is interpreted as identity by jTmjp)

Parameters:

  • x (Tensor) – input of the network

  • target (Tensor) – output of the network

  • nnj_module (Sequential) – neural network module

Return type:

Tensor

class pytorch_laplace.CEHessianCalculator(*args, **kwargs)¶

Multi-Class Cross Entropy

Warning

Currently only support one point prediction (for now) for example:

  • Classifying mnist digits will work

  • Pixelwise classification to segment digits will not work

compute_loss(x, target, nnj_module, reshape=None)¶

Computes Cross Entropy

Parameters:

  • x (Tensor) – input of the network

  • target (Tensor) – output of the network

  • nnj_module (Sequential) – neural network module

  • reshape (Optional[Tuple]) – reshape logits to this shape before computing cross entropy

Return type:

Tensor

compute_gradient(x, target, nnj_module, reshape=None)¶

Compute gradient of cross entropy

Parameters:

  • x (Tensor) – input of the network

  • target (Tensor) – output of the network

  • nnj_module (Sequential) – neural network module

  • reshape (Optional[Tuple]) – reshape logits to this shape before computing cross entropy

Return type:

Tensor

compute_hessian(x, target, nnj_module, save_memory=False, reshape=None)¶

Compute Hessian of cross entropy

Parameters:

  • x (Tensor) – input of the network

  • target (Tensor) – output of the network

  • nnj_module (Sequential) – neural network module

  • reshape (Optional[Tuple]) – reshape logits to this shape before computing cross entropy

  • save_memory (bool) –

Return type:

Tensor

compute_hessian(x, target, nnj_module)¶

Computes Generalized Gauss-Newton approximation (J^T H J) of the hessian of the network

Parameters:

  • x (Tensor) – input of the network

  • target (Tensor) – output of the network

  • nnj_module (Sequential) – neural network module

Return type:

Tensor

class pytorch_laplace.ContrastiveHessianCalculator(method, *args, **kwargs)¶

Contrastive Loss

\[L(x,y) = 0.5 * || x - y ||\]
\[Contrastive(x, tuples) = \sum_{positives} L(x,y) - \sum_{negatives} L(x,y)\]

Note

The contrastive loss value is the same for method == “full” and method == “fix”, however, the second order derivatives vary.

Parameters:

method (Literal['full', 'fix', 'pos']) –

compute_loss(x, target, nnj_module, tuple_indices)¶

Compute contrastive loss

\[L_{con} = 0.5 * || x - y ||^2\]

where \(x\) and \(y\) are the embeddings of the anchor and positive/negative samples.

Parameters:

  • x (Tensor) – Images of the anchor and positive/negative samples.

  • target (Tensor) – Embeddings of the anchor and positive/negative samples.

  • nnj_module (Sequential) – Neural network module.

  • tuple_indices (Tuple) – Tuple indices, either (a,p,n) or (a,p,a,n).

Return type:

Tensor

compute_gradient(x, target, nnj_module, tuple_indices)¶

Compute contrastive gradient

Parameters:

  • x (Tensor) – Images of the anchor and positive/negative samples.

  • target (Tensor) – Embeddings of the anchor and positive/negative samples.

  • nnj_module (Sequential) – Neural network module.

  • tuple_indices (Tuple) – Tuple indices, either (a,p,n) or (a,p,a,n).

Return type:

Tensor

compute_hessian(x, target, nnj_module, tuple_indices)¶

Compute contrastive hessian

Parameters:

  • x (Tensor) – Images of the anchor and positive/negative samples.

  • target (Tensor) – Embeddings of the anchor and positive/negative samples.

  • nnj_module (Sequential) – Neural network module.

  • tuple_indices (Tuple) – Tuple indices, either (a,p,n) or (a,p,a,n).

Return type:

Tensor
